metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12356 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in password-store.sh in pass in Simple PasswordStore 1.7.x before 1.7.2. The signature verification routine parses theoutput of GnuPG with an incomplete regular expression, which allows remoteattackers to spoof file signatures on configuration files and extensionscripts. Modifying the configuration file allows the attacker to injectadditional encryption keys under their control, thereby disclosingpasswords to the attacker. Modifying the extension scripts allows theattacker arbitrary code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12356` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pass - 1.7.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: password-store package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.7.2-1').
